title-group.article-title: Application of computer simulation modeling in the health care sector: a survey

article-meta.aff: Institute of Organization and Management, Wrocław University of Technology, Poland

author-notes.corresp: Bożena Mielczarek, Institute of Organization and Management, Wrocław University of Technology, Wybrzeże Wyspiańskiego 27, 50-370 Wrocław, Poland Email: bozena.mielczarek@pwr.wroc.pl

fn.p: Bożena Mielczarek is an assistant professor of Management Science at Wroclaw University of Technology, Poland. She received her MSc in Management Science and PhD in Economics from Wroclaw University of Technology. Her research interests include simulation modeling methodologies, health service research, decision support, and risk analysis.

Justyna Uziałko-Mydlikowska is presently working for the National Health Fund in Wroclaw, Poland. She received her MSc in Management Sciences and PhD in Economics from Wroclaw University of Technology. Her research interests include simulation modeling methodologies and health service research.

abstract.p: This article aims to present examples of computer simulation models that support decision-making processes in the health care sector. The objective of this review is to propose a system of classification of health care topic areas examined with the assistance of simulation methods. The categories described in literature were expanded and a detailed taxonomy for sub-groups was formulated. Usefulness of simulation modeling techniques was investigated and an attempt was made to correlate the simulation approach with a corresponding health care application group from the suggested classification.
